de.lmu.ifi.dbs.jfeaturelib.features

Class AbstractFeatureDescriptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.jfeaturelib.features.AbstractFeatureDescriptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Descriptor, FeatureDescriptor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AdaptiveGridResolution, AutoColorCorrelogram, CEDD, CentroidBoundaryDistance, CentroidFeature, ColorHistogram, Compactness, Eccentricity, ExtremalPoints, FCTH, FuzzyHistogram, Gabor, Haralick, Histogram, JCD, Moments, PHOG, PolygonEvolution, Profiles, ReferenceColorSimilarity, Sift, SquareModelShapeMatrix, SURF, Tamura, Thumbnail

    public abstract class AbstractFeatureDescriptor
extends Object
implements FeatureDescriptor
    This abstract class provides some convenient base functionalities for feature descriptors like the getter for the data (including null check) and the propery change support.
    Author:
    Franz

    • Method Detail

      • getFeatures

        public List<double[]> getFeatures()
        Returns a reference to the data calculated by the according descriptor. The list will most likely just containa single double array holding the computed values. In cases where a descriptor computes mutliple features (for example SIFT, where a vector is calculated for each point of interest), the list will contain several double arrays.
        Specified by:
        getFeatures in interface FeatureDescriptor
        Returns:
        list of feature vectors.

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Adds a Property change listener for this feature vector. During the computation of the descriptor, at least 2 progress events should be fired (Start/End).
        Specified by:
        addPropertyChangeListener in interface Descriptor
        Parameters:
        listener -
        See Also:
        Progress.START, Progress.END, Progress

      • addData

        protected void addData(double[] data)
        Adds the double array to the list. Keep in mind that the array is NOT copied but directly put into the list.
        See Also:
        data

      • addData

        protected void addData(int[] data)

      • addData

        protected void addData(List<double[]> data)
        Adds the double array list to the list of data arrays. Keep in mind that the array is NOT copied but directly put into the list.
        See Also:
        data

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(Progress event)
        Propagates the given progress event using property change support. The old value of the firePropertyChange is the most recent progress event that was propagated by this method (null in case of the first event).
        Parameters:
        event -

        protected void setMask(ij.process.ImageProcessor ip)
        Sets / stores the mask applied to the referenced image processor.
        Parameters:

      • inMask

        protected boolean inMask(int x,
             int y)
        Check wether a pixel is inside a set mask. If no mask is applied, then the method always returns true. If a pixel is in the mask, this means that it should be processed.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        true if the pixel is in the mask and should thus be processed.
